00031 template<class T>
00032 class Array_base : public virtual Object {
00033     friend class Array<T>;
00034 public:
00035     class iterator : public RandomAccessIterator<T, Array<T> > {
00036     public:
00037         S_RANDOM_ACCESS_ITERATOR(iterator,T, Array<T>)
00038         void construct(bool begin, Array<T>* obj) {
00039             _obj = obj;
00040             _currentIndex = begin ? 0 : _obj->length;
00041         }
00042         bool equals(iterator& other) {
00043             return _currentIndex == other._currentIndex &&
00044                     _obj == other._obj;
00045         }
00046         void copyFrom(iterator& other) {
00047             _currentIndex = other._currentIndex;
00048             _obj = other._obj;
00049         }
00050         pointer current() {
00051             return *_obj[_currentIndex];
00052         }
00053         bool hasNext() {
00054             return _obj->length < _currentIndex;
00055         }
00056         void next() {
00057             _currentIndex++;
00058         }
00059         bool hasPrevious() {
00060             return _currentIndex >= 0;
00061         }
00062         void previous() {
00063             currentIndex--;
00064         }
00065         idx_t currentIndex() {
00066             return _currentIndex;
00067         }
00068         size_t length() {
00069             return _obj->length;
00070         }
00071     private:
00072         mutable idx_t _currentIndex;
00073         Array<T>* _obj;
00074     };
00075     S_ITERABLE(T)
00076 public:
00083     typedef bool(*FilterFunction)(const T&, Any&);
00089     const int & length;
00098     inline static Array<T> fromPointer(std::size_t length, T * orig) {
00099         Array<T> ar(length);
00100         for (int x = 0; x < length; x++)ar[x] = orig[x];
00101         return ar;
00102     }
00103 public:
00104 
00112     explicit Array_base(std::size_t len) : _length(len), length(_length) {
00113         data = new Data(len);
00114         data->_carray = new T[length];
00115     }
00116 
00123     Array_base(const std::initializer_list<T> & il) : _length(il.size()), length(_length) {
00124         data = new Data(_length);
00125         data->_carray = (T*) calloc(il.size(), sizeof (T));
00126         carraycopy(il.begin(), 0, data->_carray, 0, il.size());
00127     }
00128 
00136     Array_base(const T array[]) : _length(carraysize(array)), length(_length) {
00137         data = new Data(_length);
00138         data->_carray = (T*) calloc(_length, sizeof (T));
00139         carraycopy(array, 0, data->_carray, 0, _length);
00140     }
00141 
00147     Array_base(const Array_base<T> & other) : _length(other._length) {
00148         if (this == &other) return;
00149         this->data = other.data;
00150         this->_length = other.data->_length;
00151         data->refcount++;
00152     }
00164     Array_base(const basic_range<T> & ran) : _length(ran.last() - ran.first()),
00165             length(_length) {
00166         data = new Data(_length);
00167         data->_carray = (T*) calloc(_length, sizeof (T));
00168         idx_t idx = 0;
00169         for (T x = ran.first(); x < ran.last(); x++) {
00170             *this[idx] = x; idx++;
00171         }
00172     }
00173 
00178     virtual ~Array_base() {
00179         data->refcount--;
00180         if (!data->refcount) delete data;
00181     }
00182 
00188     T * carray() {
00189         return data->_carray;
00190     }
00191 
00198     const T *carray() const {
00199         return data->_carray;
00200     }
00201 
00210     Array_base<T> copy() {
00211         Array_base<T> toReturn(length);
00212         arraycopy(*this,0,toReturn,0,length);
00213         return toReturn;
00214     }
00215 
00224     Array_base<T> filter(FilterFunction func, Any& clientData) {
00225         // I'm terribly sorry but we'll need to iterate twice over the Array...
00226         size_t newlength;
00227         for(idx_t i = 0; i < length; i++) {
00228             if(func(*this[i],clientData)) newlength++;
00229         }
00230         Array<T> toReturn(newlength);
00231         idx_t curpos = 0;
00232         for(idx_t i = 0; i < length; i++) {
00233             if(func(*this[i],clientData)) {
00234                 toReturn[curpos] = *this[i];
00235                 curpos++;
00236             }
00237         }
00238         return toReturn;
00239     }
00240 
00249     Array_base<T> & operator=(const Array_base<T> & other) {
00250         if (this->data == other.data) return;
00251         this->data->refcount--;
00252         if (!this->data->refcount) delete this->data;
00253         this->data = other.data;
00254         this->_length = other.data->_length;
00255         data->refcount++;
00256         return *this;
00257     }
00258 
00267     T & operator[](std::sidx_t idx) throw (Exception) {
00268         if (abs(idx) < length) {
00269             return idx > 0 ? data->_carray[idx] : data->_carray(length + idx);
00270         } else {
00271             sthrow(ArrayException, "Array overflow");
00272         }
00273     }
00274 
00282     const T & operator[](std::sidx_t idx) const throw (Exception) {
00283         if (abs(idx) < length) {
00284             return idx > 0 ? data->_carray[idx] : data->_carray(length + idx);
00285         } else {
00286             sthrow(ArrayException, "Array overflow");
00287         }
00288     }
00289 
00298     Array_base<T> operator[](const range & ran) throw (Exception) {
00299         if (ran.first() < 0 || ran.last() > length)
00300             sthrow(ArrayException, "Array overflow");
00301 
00302         Array_base<T> toReturn = Array_base<T>::fromPointer(ran.last() - ran.first(),
00303                 data->_carray + ran.first());
00304         return toReturn;
00305     }
00306 
00312     const Array_base<T> operator[](const range & ran) const throw (Exception) {
00313         if (ran.first() < 0 || ran.last() > length)
00314             sthrow(ArrayException, "Array overflow");
00315 
00316         Array_base<T> toReturn = Array_base<T>::fromPointer(ran.last() - ran.first(),
00317                 data->_carray + ran.first());
00318         return toReturn;
00319     }

00330             delete _carray;

00334         suint refcount;
00335     } * data;
00336     int _length;
00337 #endif

00442 public:
00449     explicit Array<T*>(std::size_t len) : Array_base<T>(len) {}
00460     Array<T*>(const std::initializer_list<T> & il) : Array_base<T*>(il) {}

00475     }

00485     }

00498     Array(const T* t) : Array_base<T*>(1) {
00499         *this[0] = t;
00500     }
00501 
00507     virtual ~Array<T*>() {
00508         for(idx_t i = 0; i < length; i++) {
00509             delete *this[i];
00510         }
00511     }
00512 };

00526 template<class T>
00527 inline bool operator==(const Array<T>& lhs, const Array<T>& rhs) {
00528     return lhs.length == rhs.length ?
00529             std::equal(lhs.carray[0], lhs.carray[lhs.length - 1], rhs[0]) : false;
00530 }
00531 
00539 template<class T>
00540 inline bool operator<(const Array<T>& lhs, const Array<T>& rhs) {
00541     return lhs.length == rhs.length ?
00542             std::lexicographical_compare(lhs.carray[0], lhs.carray[lhs.length - 1],
00543             rhs[0], rhs[rhs.length - 1]) : false;
00544 }
